revised_title: Discovery of Homeoboxes in Cnidarian Genomes
tldr: The authors discovered the first homeobox gene, eveC, in a diploblastic organism, the cnidarian Acropora formosa. This finding supports the co-option hypothesis, suggesting that homeobox genes were an early feature of metazoan genomes and were later co-opted for roles in segmentation in triploblastic organisms.
